name: MASVS-STORAGE - MASVS-STORAGE-1
description: The app securely stores sensitive data.

rules.description: STORAGE-1: Testing Local Storage for Sensitive Data --> Internal Storage
rules.note:
Sensitive files saved to the internal storage should not be accessed by other application.
	Modes such asÂ MODE_WORLD_READABLE and MODE_WORLD_WRITEABLE may pose a security risk.
rules.reference:
CWE-922: Insecure Storage of Sensitive Information.
	https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/922.html

rules.description: STORAGE-1: Testing Local Storage for Sensitive Data --> External Storage
rules.note:
Any sensitive data should not be stored in the external storage.
	Files stored outside the application folder (data/data/<package-name>/) will not be deleted when the user uninstalls the application.
	Files saved to external storage are world-readable and it can be used by an attacker to allow for arbitrary control of the application in some cases.
rules.reference:
CWE-922: Insecure Storage of Sensitive Information.
	https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/922.html

rules.description: STORAGE-1: Testing Local Storage for Sensitive Data --> Temporary File Creation
rules.note:
Temporary files should be securely deleted upon their usage.
	Creating and using insecure temporary files can leave application and system data vulnerable to attack.

rules.description: STORAGE-1: Testing Local Storage for Sensitive Data --> Shared Preferences
rules.note:
Should use Shared Preferences carefully.
	Misuse of the SharedPreferences API can often lead to the exposure of sensitive data.
rules.reference:
CWE-922: Insecure Storage of Sensitive Information.
	https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/922.html

rules.description: STORAGE-1: Testing Local Storage for Sensitive Data --> SQLite Database
rules.note:
Sensitive information should not be stored in unencrypted SQLite databases.
	SQLite databases should be password-encrypted.
rules.reference:
CWE-922: Insecure Storage of Sensitive Information.
	https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/922.html

rules.description: STORAGE-1: Testing Local Storage for Sensitive Data --> Realm Database
rules.note:
Should not misconfigure Realm database.
	If the database is not encrypted, you should be able to obtain the data.
	If the database is encrypted, determine whether the key is hard-coded in the source or resources and whether it is stored unprotected in shared preferences or some other location.
rules.reference:
CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor.
	https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/200.html

rules.description: STORAGE-1: Testing Local Storage for Sensitive Data --> Firebase Database
rules.note:
Should not misconfigure Firebase Realtime database.
	If the security rules permit open access or fail to restrict access to specific users for particular datasets, an attacker can gain unauthorized access to read the database content without requiring any authentication.
rules.reference:
CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor.
	https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/200.html
